channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration.

item.title: Report E-2025020122
item.description:
Report E-2025020122

Identified by scraper @ 2025-02-13T06:18:15+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-01-10
  • City: TURRELL
  • State: AR
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 48500
  • Serious Incident Ind: Yes
  • Description: At 06:59ET, XPO notified the Call Center of a roadside cargo release in Turrell, AR. It was reported that an unknown amount of Bio-Soft S-101 released from potentially eight 275-gallon totes due to accident caused by icy roads. The release impacted asphalt and soil. No storm drains or waterways are reported to be impacted by the release. Call Center will proceed to dispatch a contractor to the site to complete cleanup activities. An ETA will be provided once it is known. Chemtrec has been notified, report #2025011000036 was given by Alex. Arkansas Dept. of Energy & Environment, Emergency Management and Arkansas Division of Emergency Management have been notified, no report number was given by Dee with the Arkansas Dept. of Energy & Environment, Emergency Management. Report #41308 was given by Glen with the Arkansas Division of Emergency Management.

item.title: Report E-2025020099
item.description:
Report E-2025020099

Identified by scraper @ 2025-02-13T06:18:15+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-01-08
  • City: GEORGETOWN
  • State: DE
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: QUALITY CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: DELIVERY DRIVER WAS DIRECTED BY THE CONSIGNEE EMPLOYEE TO UNLOAD THE TRAILER INTO AN UNLABLED LINE THAT LED TO A TANK CONTAINING PEROXYACETIC ACID. AS THE DRIVER STARTED TO UNLOAD THE CAUSTIC SODA INTO THE PA TANK, A CHEMICAL REACTION OCCURED. THE DRIVER SHUT OFF THE TRAILER VALVE TO STOP THE CAUSTIC SODA UNLOAD. AN UNKOWN AMOUNT OF VAPOR WAS RELEASED, CAUSING THE CONSIGNEE EVACUATION. REPORTED 1 OUNCE RELEASE SO THE REPORT COULD BE FILED NO CT EQUIPMENT FAILURE CONSIGNEE HUMAN ERROR CAUSED THE RELEASE

item.title: Report E-2025020093
item.description:
Report E-2025020093

Identified by scraper @ 2025-02-10T06:19:23+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-02-03
  • City: WILMINGTON
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: Yes
  • Description: On February 3, 2025, one (1) 330-gallon tote of phosphoric acid was punctured and released approximately 330-gallons of product to the asphalt pavement and nearby storm drain. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Thin Line Environmental (TLE) to remediate the impacted site. TLE personnel noted that the product released into a storm drain onsite and began utilizing a vacuum trailer to remove the liquids at each storm drain between the terminal building and the retention pond. All acid impacted liquids were collected and containerized into three (3) 330-gallon totes and one (1) 275-gallon tote and staged onsite for further management.

item.title: Report E-2025010367
item.description:
Report E-2025010367

Identified by scraper @ 2025-02-10T06:19:23+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-01-18
  • City: DUANESBURG
  • State: NY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: L.P. TRANSPORTATION, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 1
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: Yes
  • Description: Driver stated he had finished unloading, closed all valves including the trailer's internal valve and disconnected the unloading hose. While attempting to replace the protective cap on the outlet fitting, the Driver states he either slipped and reached out for something(valve) to "catch " himself or the cap's safety chain(cable) became draped over the valve handle and when he pulled the cap the valve opened slightly. Residual product exited the outlet contacting the driver in the mid section. There was no failure of packaging, valves or equipment.

  • Description: Container SMLU 794269-2 containing UN3109 Organic Peroxide Type F, Liquid, Class 5.2 was reported leaking onboard M/V Seaboard Gemini on its way from Savanah to KGT. A decision was made to divert the ship to Miami to address the situation. Cliff Berry Inc. was called for the spill cleanup. Incident reported to NRC; report number 1419124.

item.title: Report E-2025010433
item.description:
Report E-2025010433

Identified by scraper @ 2025-02-08T03:31:42+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-01-03
  • City: EAST BRUNSWICK
  • State: NJ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: A Duie Pyle
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 9500
  • Serious Incident Ind: Yes
  • Description: On January 03, 2025, A Duie Pyle notified Emergency Response and Training Solutions (ERTS) of a cargo release in East Brunswick, NJ. It was reported that approximately 300 gallons of UN1170 Ethanol released from a metal tote due to improper handling. The release impacted the inside of a trailer and asphalt. No storm drains or waterways were impacted. Clean Harbors was dispatched to the site to perform all onsite clean-up. Upon arrival CH reported the team inspected the tote to find it was knocked over and the lid popped off. CH reported they moved the tote upright and placed the lid back on. The team then began to work in absorbents. All clean up was completed creating eleven 55-gallon drums of impacted absorbents. All waste was taken off-site for proper disposal.

item.title: Report E-2025020021
item.description:
Report E-2025020021

Identified by scraper @ 2025-02-08T03:31:42+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-01-01
  • City: BISCOE
  • State: NC
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: QUALITY CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: Yes
  • Description: Driver connected the Consignee's hose that leads into the storage tank. He noticed the hose gasket did not look good and replaced the gasket. There were no issues initially with the unload. The driver the unload area unattended to use the restroom. Upon returning to the trailer, the hose was leaking at the location of the replaced gasket. 200 gallons of product released. The Release impacted an area of 5’X50’ on concrete and asphalt. No soil or drains were impacted. Area was pressure-washed and the water was collected for disposal.

item.title: Report I-2025010018
item.description:
Report I-2025010018

Identified by scraper @ 2025-02-08T03:31:42+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-12-11
  • City: DANDRIDGE
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Medical Delivery Services
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 1500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: At approximately 11 :00 am ET on December 11, PETNET Knoxville-UT was notified that an MDS courier transporting three PETNET cases containing live patient doses had been involved in a single-vehicle rollover accident on eastbound Interstate 40 near mile marker 424. The bills of lading for those packages are in Attachment 1. The cases contained a total of five patient doses with a combined activity of approximately 210 mCi of Flourine-18 at the time of the accident, and were being delivered to Haywood Regional Medical Center in Clyde, NC. Although the delivery vehicle appeared to have rolled over several times, no cases were ejected. However, a hazmat team responded to the scene and closed the eastbound lanes of the interstate for several hours. Corporate Health Physicist Chris Walters made phone contact with Chief Lee Turner, who was on the scene of the accident, at approximately 11 :40 am to assess the situation. As a result of that conversation, he requested an on-site visit from the corporate Radiation Protection team. Chief Turner relayed that he had also alerted the TN Division of Radiological Health. At approximately 1:00 PM, Corporate Radiation Safety Officer Elizabeth Gillenwalters and Health Physicist Chris Hile arrived at the scene of the accident. Using a Ludlum 44-9 pancake probe with a Model 3 Meter and a Ludlum 26-1 Integrated Frisker, very careful surveys of the vehicle, one officer's clothing that had been reported as possibly contaminated, and the surrounding area were performed. No results greater than background were identified in any areas or materials surveyed. The officer's clothing items were left at the scene. All three delivery cases were still intact with the security zip tie still in place. Each case was thoroughly wiped on the outside, and the wipes surveyed with the Ludlum 26-1 Integrated Frisker. No results greater than background were identified, verifying no material had left containment. The cases were loaded into our vehicle and returned them to the PETNET UT Knoxville facility, located within the UT Medical Center. Additional photos of the packages and the scene are included in Attachments 2 and 3, respectively.

item.title: Report E-2024120272
item.description:
Report E-2024120272

Identified by scraper @ 2025-02-07T00:48:34+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-09-27
  • City: MOSHEIM
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Holston Gases, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 127250
  • Serious Incident Ind: Yes
  • Description: Driver had been making propane deliveries during the remnants of Hurricane Helene. Weather conditions were rainy with very high gusty winds. Driver stated that heavy wind gust caught the truck and pushed the truck toward the shoulder of the roadway. Right side tires dropped off the asphalt and when the driver corrected truck proceeded to overturn in the roadway and rolled coming to a stop on its side. Impact from the rollover damage one of the vapor return valves on the back of the truck and it started leaking propane. Area was secured when law enforcement arrived at the scene. Roadway was closed due to leaking propane. Fire Department and Greenville TN Hazmat team also responded to the site. Response team connected a vapor hose to the truck and routed it away from the truck so that vapor could be flared off to reduce the vapor pressure in the tank. Once the vapor pressure the was reduced the leak subsequently stopped so that the truck could be returned to its wheels and towed from the site.
